byline.contributor: Ahmed Saleh and Falih Hassan contributed reporting from Baghdad, and employees of The New York Times from Salahuddin Province and Najaf, Iraq.

abstract: Iraqi Defense Min Khaled al-Obeidi says plan to drive Islamic State militants from Mosul, most challenging operation in fight against group, will be planned and carried out by Iraqis; statement appears to be rebuke against American officials' assertion that Iraqi forces will not be ready to carry out operation for months.
lead_paragraph: Amid concerns about Iranian involvement in the offensive against the Islamic State, the Iraqi defense minister said the Mosul mission would be “planned, timed and executed by Iraqis.”

headline.main: Iraqis Want Lead Role in Driving ISIS From Mosul
headline.print_headline: Iraqis Want Lead Role in Driving ISIS From Mosul

snippet: Amid concerns about Iranian involvement in the offensive against the Islamic State, the Iraqi defense minister said the Mosul mission would be “planned, timed and executed by Iraqis.”

keywords.value: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
keywords.name: organizations
